title: Branch Protection Drift Summary
description: Machine-readable summary emitted by verify-branch-protection workflow. Captures expected vs actual required status-check contexts, drift, and token/permission booleans. schema_version is pinned for evidence packs.

schema_version.description: Pinned schema version for bp_drift_summary.json exhibits.

mode.description: Which policy profile was used to define expected contexts.

expected_contexts.description: Required status-check contexts as defined by policy-as-code.

actual_contexts.description: Required status-check contexts fetched from live branch protection. Empty when token is missing or cannot read.

missing_contexts.description: expected_contexts entries not present in actual_contexts.

extra_contexts.description: actual_contexts entries not present in expected_contexts.

ok.description: True iff token_admin_read_ok is true and missing_contexts/extra_contexts are both empty.

token_present.description: True iff BRANCH_PROTECTION_TOKEN was present in the workflow environment.

token_admin_read_ok.description: True iff token allowed reading branch protection required_status_checks (Administration: Read).

token_admin_read_http_status.description: HTTP status code returned by the required_status_checks probe. 200=ok, 401=bad auth/header, 403=permission denied, 404=not found (often permission or endpoint), 0=network/curl/fetch failure. Non-identifying.

token_checked_at.description: ISO-8601 timestamp for when the token capability checks were performed (non-identifying).

token_scope_repo.description: True iff the workflow successfully used the token against repo-scoped endpoints (non-identifying).

token_permission_admin_read.description: True iff the token appears to have Administration: Read for this repo (alias of token_admin_read_ok; non-identifying).
